thread.title: Girls tennis: Verona Hillbillies crowned sectional champions
thread.title_full: Girls tennis: Verona Hillbillies crowned sectional champions

title: Girls tennis: Verona Hillbillies crowned sectional champions
text:
Photo Courtesy Josh Cogdill Verona Lady Hillbillies won the North 2 Group 1 state sectional title Tuesday, Oct. 13. 
The Verona girls tennis team defeated New Providence to capture the sectional championship Tuesday, Oct. 13. The Lady Hillbillies were victorious against Dayton and Glen Ridge and increased their winning streak to 12 en route to being crowned champions. 
The Lady Hillbillies earned a 3-2 win over New Providence Tuesday, Oct. 13. Sophomore Dasha Yakhnis won her first singles match 6-3, 6-4 and senior Nell Karpinski swept her second singles contest 6-4, 6-4. Junior Alexis Duhaney earned a 5-7, 6-3, 6-3 win in her third singles game. 
Sophomore Julia Cambreleng and junior Michelle Lima fell 2-6, 0-6 in the first doubles match. Freshman Kayla Golebieski and sophomore Julianna Tuorto could not overcome their New Providence opponents 1-6, 1-6. 
The Lady Hillbillies' victory over New Providence gave them a 13-3 record on the season after previously dispatching Dayton and Glen Ridge before the sectional tilt. 
Verona earned a 5-0 win over Dayton Thursday, Oct. 8. Yakhnis earned the win in the first singles match 6-1, 6-3, while Karpinski won the second singles game 6-2, 6-1. Duhaney earned a 6-0, 6-1 win in her third singles contest. 
Cambreleng and Lima worked together to earn a 6-4, 6-1 win in the first doubles match. Kayla Golebieski and Julianna Tuorto won the second doubles contest 12-10, 10-7 to secure the victory. 
Verona defeated Glen Ridge 3-2 Monday, Oct. 12. Yakhnis earned a 6-4, 6-1 victory in first singles, while Duhaney won her second singles match 6-1, 6-2. Sophomore Marwa Elessawy fell in the third singles contest 7-5, 6-1. 
Cambreleng and Lima dropped their first doubles tilt 6-4, 6-4 and the Tuorto-Golebieski paring earned a 7-5, 7-6 (7-4) victory.
